蘦字的基本解释

蘦
lìng
甘草。
古通“零”，零落。

蘦字的汉语字典释义

[①]［líng］
［《廣韻》郎丁切，平青，來。］
(1)药草名。
(2)同“零”。零落。

蘦字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　蘦； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页1069第39
【唐韻】郞丁切，音靈。【說文】大苦也。【爾雅·釋草】蘦，大苦。【疏】今甘草也。或曰與苓同，《詩》采苓采苓是也。　又通零。【爾雅·釋詁】落也。【楚辭·遠遊】悼芳草之先蘦。　亦作蕶。

蘦字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
蘦字的起名意思

甘草。

蘦
Basic explanation of words
蘦
lìng
Licorice.
Gutong "zero", scattered.
蘦
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［líng］
["Guangyun" Lang Dingqie, Pingqing, come. ]
(1) The name of the herb.
(2) Same as "zero". scattered.
蘦
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Zong Zi] 　蘦; Kangxi Strokes: 23; Page Number: Page 1069 Page 39
[Tang Yun] Yin Ding cut, the sound is good. [Said the text] It's hard. [Erya Shicao] Suffering and suffering. [Sparse] Licorice is also today. In other words, it is the same as Ling, so it is Cai Ling Cai Ling in The Poetry.　Zero again. 【Erya·Shiguo】Luo Ye. [Songs of the Chu·Yuanyou] The first to mourn the fragrant grass.　Also as 蕶.
蘦
